Package Steganography.Logic

Class BaseSteganography

  • java.lang.Object
    • Steganography.Logic.BaseSteganography
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    GifSteganography, ImageSteganography

    public abstract class BaseSteganography
extends java.lang.Object
    The abstract BaseSteganography class is the superclass of all the classes used in the steganographic process.

    • Field Summary

      y-axis current pixel position

      Encoding mode (1 or 2 pixels/byte).
      (package private) HiddenData secretInfo
      Contains info about the embedded data in a readable format.

    • Method Detail

      • encode

        public abstract void encode​(byte[] message,
                            java.io.File output)
                     throws java.io.IOException,
                            CannotEncodeException
        Encodes a byte array into a cover image.

        A subclass must provide an implementation of this method.

        Parameters:
        message - message to embed in the cover image
        output - stego image with the embedded message
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurs when creating the stego image.
        CannotEncodeException - if the message is empty or larger than maximum capacity.

      • encode

        public abstract void encode​(java.io.File doc,
                            java.io.File output)
                     throws java.io.IOException,
                            CannotEncodeException
        Encodes a document file into a cover image.

        A subclass must provide an implementation of this method.

        Parameters:
        doc - document to embed in the cover image
        output - stego image with embedded document
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurs while reading the secret file or creating the stego image.
        CannotEncodeException - if the file is empty or larger than maximum capacity.

      • decode

        public abstract void decode​(java.io.File file)
                     throws java.io.IOException,
                            CannotDecodeException
        Decodes the content of a stego image and saves it to a file.

        A subclass must provide an implementation of this method.

        Parameters:
        file - destination of the embedded data in the stego image
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurs while writing hidden data to the file.
        CannotDecodeException - if there is no data embedded in the stego image.

      • getHeader

        public abstract byte[] getHeader​()
                          throws CannotDecodeException
        Returns the header containing information about the embedded data from a stego image.

        A subclass must provide an implementation of this method.

        Returns:
        a byte array with the information about the embedded data.
        Throws:
        CannotDecodeException - if there is no data embedded in the stego image.

      • increment

        protected abstract void increment​()
        Increments the position of the current pixel in the image.

        A subclass must provide an implementation of this method.

      • reset

        protected abstract void reset​()
        Resets the value of the index.

        A subclass must provide an implementation of this method.

      • getCapacity

        public long getCapacity​()
        Returns the capacity of the cover image.

        A subclass must provide an implementation of this method.

        Returns:
        the cover image capacity.

      • getSecretInfo

        protected HiddenData getSecretInfo​()
        Returns the secretInfo field containing the info about the embedded data of the stego image.
        Returns:
        a HiddenData Object that contains the info about the embedded data.

      • setSecretInfo

        void setSecretInfo​(HiddenData info)
        Sets the secretInfo field containing info about the embedded data in the stego image.
        Parameters:
        info - HiddenData object containing the info about the embedded data

      • setHeader

        byte[] setHeader​(byte[] message)
          throws CannotEncodeException
        Sets the class header field with information about a message to embed in the image.

        The header contains the following :

        ['M', Encryption Status ('E' | 'C'), Compression Status ('C' | 'U'), Pixels/Byte (1|2), Message length (2 bits = 65535 bytes), '!']

        Example:

        [01001101, 01000100, 01010101, 00000001, 00110011, 11001100, 00100001]

        Corresponds to:

        ['M' (Message), 'E' (isEncrypted), 'U' (!isCompressed), 1 Pixel/Byte, 13260 bytes, '!']
        Parameters:
        message - message to embed info about to the header field
        Returns:
        a byte array that contains information about the message to embed.
        Throws:
        CannotEncodeException - if the message is empty or larger than maximum capacity.

      • setHeader

        byte[] setHeader​(java.io.File file)
          throws java.io.IOException,
                 CannotEncodeException
        Sets the class header field with information about a file document to embed in the image.

        The header contains the following :

        ['D', Encryption Status ('E' | 'C'), Compression Status ('C' | 'U'), Pixels/Byte (1|2), File length (3 bits = 16777215 bytes), File extension, '!']

        Example:

        [01000100, 01000101, 01000011, 00000010, 01010101, 10101010, 01010101, 01001010, 01000001, 01010110, 01000001, 00100001]

        Corresponds to:

        ['D' (Document), 'E' (isEncrypted), 'C' (isCompressed), 2 Pixel/Byte, 5614165 bytes, .java extension, '!']
        Parameters:
        file - file document to embed info about to the header field
        Returns:
        a byte array that contains information about the file document to embed.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurs while handling the file.
        CannotEncodeException - if file is empty or larger than maximum capacity.
